title: New York Today: New York Today: Documenting Hate Crimes
text:
Continue reading the main story “We still don’t have comprehensive data on basic questions about hate crimes, like how many occur every year,” said Anna North, a staff editor at The New York Times Opinion Pages . She has been writing about hate crimes — vandalism, verbal harassment and threats — in the Opinions column “ This Week in Hate .” 
Advertisement Continue reading the main story To better understand the nature of hate crimes, the opinion section has partnered with ProPublica and other news media organizations, civil-rights groups and schools on the project “ Documenting Hate ,” which collects data on hate crimes and bias incidents across the United States. The database would be used to determine where people were most at risk, who was more likely to be victimized and trends among perpetrators, Ms. North said. And you can help. If you have experienced, witnessed or read about a hate crime, tell us about it using this form . To report an incident of bias, you can call the state hotline at 888-392-3644. And here are more resources for those who have experienced harassment. Here’s what else is happening: Weather It’ll be 51 today , but you’re waking up — to rain. You’ll step out for lunch — while it rains. You’ll head home this evening — in the rain. To top it all off, there’s fog fuzzying our otherwise-lovely city skyline. Hair forecast: Chewed-up Chewbacca . In the News • The evidence in the murder of the Queens jogger Karina Vetrano points to one person, the police say.
